column4: Silly question which I've found the answer to before but can't seem to now that I need it ... how do I set a shell script to run a process sudo'ed without needing to enter the password?
you need to edit /etc/sudoers for the command to be run with the NOPASSWD flag
use visudo to edit sudoers, and read up on man sudoers
That was it ... I was looking in /etc and just blind today :) ... thanks alot :)
